# Text Formatting Features

This document demonstrates all text formatting capabilities supported by Quarto.

## Basic Emphasis

You can apply various text emphasis styles:

- *Italic text* using `*text*`
- **Bold text** using `**text**`
- ***Bold and italic text*** using `***text***`
- ~~Strikethrough text~~ using `~~text~~`

## Superscript and Subscript

- Superscript: E=mc^2^ using `text^2^`
- Subscript: H~2~O using `text~2~`
- Combined: x^2^ + y^2^ = z^2^

## Inline Code and Links

- Inline code: `function_name()` using backticks
- [Link to Quarto](https://quarto.org)
- [Link with title](https://quarto.org "Visit Quarto")
- Automatic link: <https://quarto.org>

## Blockquotes

> This is a blockquote. It can span multiple lines and contain other formatting.
>
> You can also have multiple paragraphs in a blockquote.

> "A blockquote with attribution"
> — Author Name

## Footnotes

Here's a footnote reference[^1] and another one[^2].

[^1]: This is the first footnote content.
[^2]: This is the second footnote content with more details.

## Definition Lists

Term 1
:   The definition of the first term goes here. It can contain multiple lines and formatting.

Term 2
:   The definition of the second term.
:   Multiple definitions are also supported.

## Task Lists

- [x] Completed task
- [ ] Incomplete task
- [x] Another completed task with **bold** text
- [ ] Task with [a link](https://quarto.org)

## Headings

Quarto supports six levels of headings:

# Heading Level 1

## Heading Level 2

### Heading Level 3

#### Heading Level 4

##### Heading Level 5

###### Heading Level 6

## Lists

### Unordered Lists

- First item
- Second item
  - Nested item 1
  - Nested item 2
    - Deeply nested item
- Third item with **bold** and *italic* text
- Item with [a link](https://quarto.org)

### Ordered Lists

1. First item
2. Second item
   a. Sub-item A
   b. Sub-item B
3. Third item
4. Item with code: use `function()` here

### Mixed Lists

1. Ordered item
   - Unordered sub-item
   - Another sub-item
     1. Nested ordered item
     2. Another nested ordered
2. Back to ordered item

## Line Breaks and Horizontal Rules

You can create hard line breaks using two spaces at the end of a line.
This line appears on a new line.

Horizontal rules can be created with:

---

Multiple dashes, asterisks, or underscores work.

***

## Special Characters

Quarto supports smart typography:

- "Curly quotes" instead of "straight quotes"
- 'Single quotes' work too
- Dashes: em—dash, en–dash, and hyphen-word
- Ellipsis...

## Raw Inline Content

You can include raw HTML: <mark>highlighted text</mark>

Or LaTeX commands: $\LaTeX$

## Unicode and Emoji Support

- Mathematical symbols: ∑ ∫ ∂ ∇
- Currency symbols: € £ ¥ ₹
- Arrows: ← → ↑ ↓
- Other: © ® ™ § ¶

## Spans with Attributes

[This text has a CSS class]{.highlight}

[Red text]{style="color: red;"}

## Conclusion

These text formatting features form the foundation of document authoring in Quarto. Try editing these elements in the review extension to see how they behave!
